intro: Spermacoce capitata var. normalis, commonly known as the common starfruit or yellow star-grass, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, yellow berries that are edible when ripe. It is native to Africa, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
